inlet.digest: Incoming knn message or bang to refresh

method.name: (keyboard)
method.description: Use Tab to set the zoom automatically depending on the displayed points

method.name: (mouse)
method.description:
When a grain is clicked, its content is output through the second outlet preceded by a "click" symbol. If the mousehover attribute is set to 1, when a grain is hovered with the mouse, its content is output through the second outlet, preceded by a "hover" symbol. In any case, grain output could be postponed if beat synchronization is active (see beatsync attribute).
Use scroll or two finger swipe to move in the plane. Use Cmd+scroll to change horizontal zoom, add Alt to change vertical zoom.

method.name: (tools)
method.description:
Tools are combination of a specific key pressed and some mouse action. Whenever you press the key, if the tool is available, the mouse cursor will switch to the tool specific one.
Available tools are:
• Keep the Z key pressed, then click and drag on the canvas to change the zoom
• Keep the X key pressed, then click and drag on the canvas to move the displayed center

method.name: autozoom
method.description: Sets domain and range automatically depending on the displayed grains.

method.name: bang
method.description: Output the sampling information regarding the sampling points set via the sample message.

method.name: clock
method.description: The word clock, followed by the name of an existing setclock objects, sets the object to be controlled by that setclock object rather than by Max's internal millisecond clock. The word clock by itself sets the object back to using Max's regular millisecond clock.

method.name: domain
method.description: The domain message, followed by two numbers, sets minimum and maximum coordinates to be displayed on the X axis. The domain message, followed by the "start" or "end" symbol and a number, sets the coordinate to be displayed respectively at the left boundary or at the right boundary of the object box.

method.name: dump
method.description: Outputs from the first outlet an llll containing the content field of all the grains.

method.name: exportimage
getdomain
method.description: The getdomain message outputs from the third outlet the minimum and maximum coordinates displayed on the X axis, preceded by a domain symbol.

method.name: getnumgrains
method.digest: Get the number of currently displayed grains
method.description: The getnumgrains message returns the number of currently displayed grains, preceded by the "numgrains" symbol, from the third outlet. N.B.: the grain calculation is performed during the paint method; unless your object is repainted, this number won't be updated. A "done" notification is sent through the third outlet whenever grains have been properly recomputed. Be sure to use such notification to trigger a getnumgrains message.

method.name: getrange
method.description: The getrange message outputs from the third outlet the minimum and maximum coordinates displayed on the Y axis, preceded by a range symbol.

method.name: getturtle
method.description: The getturtle message outputs the grain content for the grain where the turtle is currently located, if any.

method.name: knn
method.description:
The knn message, followed by an integer K and an llll of the kind [x, y], finds the K points which are nearest to the location (x, y), and outputs their content field(s) from the third outlet.
If relativeknn is on, the coordinates are expected to be between 0 and 1, relative to the current domain and range (caveat: more precisely, to the domain and range of the latest painted view of the object).

method.name: range
method.description: The range message, followed by two numbers, sets minimum and maximum coordinates to be displayed on the Y axis The range message, followed by the "start" or "end" symbol and a number, sets the coordinate to be displayed respectively at the bottom boundary or at top right boundary of the object box.

method.name: setturtle
method.description:
Examples:
• setturtle [0 10] → Set the turtle on the nearest grain to x=0, y=10
• setturtle name Warsaw → Set the turtle on the grain having "Warsaw" as content for the column "name"
The setturtle message, followed by a llll of the kind [x, y] sets the turtle on the nearest grain to the given (x, y) location, without causing any output.
If relativeturtle is on, the coordinates are expected to be between 0 and 1, relative to the current domain and range (caveat: more precisely, to the domain and range of the latest painted view of the object).
If the setturtle message is followed by a symbol, this is considered as a column name, and a column value is then expected as second argument. Syntax is setturtle colname value. In this case, the turtle is positioned on the (first found) grain (if any) having value as value for the field colname.

method.name: turtle
method.digest: Set the turtle and output grain content
method.description:
Examples:
• turtle [0 10] → Set the turtle on the nearest grain to x=0, y=10, and output content
• turtle name Warsaw → Set the turtle on the grain having "Warsaw" as content for the column "name", and output content
The turtle message, followed by a llll of the kind [x, y] sets the turtle on the nearest grain to the given (x, y) location, and outputs the grain content field(s) from the second outlet, preceded by the "turtle" symbol.
If relativeturtle is on, the coordinates are expected to be between 0 and 1, relative to the current domain and range (caveat: more precisely, to the domain and range of the latest painted view of the object).
If the turtle message is followed by a symbol, this is considered as a column name, and a column value is then expected as second argument. Syntax is turtle colname value. In this case, the turtle is positioned on the (first found) grain (if any) having value as value for the field colname.

method.name: turtledelta
method.digest: Move the turtle and output grain content
method.description:
The turtledelta message, followed by a llll of the kind [delta_x, delta_y] moves the turtle of a (delta_x, delta_y) vector and sets it to the nearest grain to the new position (ignoring the grain which previously had the turtle). The content field(s) of such grain are then output from the second outlet preceded by the "turtle" symbol.
If relativeturtle is on, the coordinates are expected to be between 0 and 1, relative to the current domain and range (caveat: more precisely, to the domain and range of the latest painted view of the object).

attribute.name: alpha
attribute.description: Sets the transparency/opacity of displayed grains.

attribute.name: autozoomwhenupdated
attribute.description: Toggles the ability to zoom automatically when the database is updated.

attribute.name: beatsync
attribute.description: Toggles the ability to postpone playing of grains depending on the beat grid given from the current tempo (see bpmfield) and depending on the grain phase (see phasefield).

attribute.name: bpmfield
attribute.description: Sets the name of the field (column) bearing the BPM value, if any (use "none" to avoid defining it).

attribute.name: colorfield
attribute.description: Sets the name of the field (column) to be mapped on the grain color, if any (use "none" to avoid defining it).

attribute.name: contentfield
attribute.description: Sets the name of the field or fields (columns) to be output when the grain is clicked or hovered (usually a score gathered syntax).

attribute.name: continuousbang
attribute.description: Toggles the ability to send the changed bang continuously during mousedrag actions.

attribute.name: convexcombfield
attribute.description: Sets the names of the fields to be used as vertices in Convex Combination mode.

attribute.name: convexcombmax
attribute.description: Sets the maximum values for the fields to be used as vertices in Convex Combination mode.

attribute.name: convexcombmin
attribute.description: Sets the minimum values for the fields to be used as vertices in Convex Combination mode.

attribute.name: convexcombp
attribute.description: Sets the p value of the norm used in Convex Combination mode.

attribute.name: database
attribute.description: Sets the database name. The database must be instantiated via a dada.base object having such name.

attribute.name: embed
attribute.description: Toggles the ability to embed the state of the object within the patcher.

attribute.name: graincolor
attribute.description: Sets the default grain color.

attribute.name: jitmatrix
attribute.description: Sets the name of a jitter matrix to which the output should be mirrored.

attribute.name: legendcolor
attribute.description: Sets the color of the legend.

attribute.name: legendsize
attribute.description: Sets the text font size for the legend.

attribute.name: lengthfield
attribute.description: Sets the name of the field (column) bearing the length of the content (in milliseconds), if any (use "none" to avoid defining it).

attribute.name: looplast
attribute.description: Toggles the ability to loop the last played grain if no other grain has been sequenced.

attribute.name: maxr
attribute.description: Sets a maximum radius for point display.

attribute.name: maxundosteps
attribute.description: Sets the maximum number of undo steps (0 being: no undo).

attribute.name: messagebang
attribute.description: Toggles the ability to send the changed bang also when changes happen via messages.

attribute.name: mindist
attribute.description: Sets a minimum distance (in milliseconds) for two grains to be scheduled. In beatsync mode, this avoids multiple grains to be scheduled at the same moment. Use a negative number to turn this behavior off.

attribute.name: minr
attribute.description: Sets a minimum radius for point display.

attribute.name: mode
attribute.description: Sets the display mode: Cartesian (default) or Convex Combination

attribute.name: notify
attribute.description: Toggles the ability to send notifications for interface activities (such as clicks, mousehovers, etc.). Notifications are sent through the dedicated outlet. If the "Verbose" mode is set, whenever meaningful, the state of the notified element will be also output.

attribute.name: notifypaint
attribute.description: Toggles the ability to notify every new redraw of the box via a "painted" symbol.

attribute.name: out
attribute.description:
The out attribute is a sequence of characters identifying the outlet types (one character for each llll outlet). Characters can be one of the following:
n (default): 'native' output: faster and more precise between bach objects, but unreadable by standard Max objects (an "bach.llll" message appears instead).
t: 'text' output: slower and limited in size, but readable by standard Max objects. A plain llll in text format is a generic Max message. To keep the representation invertible (i.e., to allow a bach object receiving a text-format llll to interpret it exactly as if it was native format, except for the size limitation), some specific kinds of symbols are preceded by a backtick: namely, symbols containing parens, or containing textual representations of numbers or pitches, or beginning with a backtick, plus the symbols "null" and "nil" (distinct from the reserved words "null" and "nil" representing the empty list and the empty sublist) are preceded by a backtick. Moreover, the symbols "int", "float" or "list" are preceded by a backtick only if they are the first element of an llll, to distinguish them from the corresponding reserved messages of Max.
m: 'max' output: mostly equivalent to the "t" specifier, but no symbol is backticket except "int", "float" and "list" at the beginning of an llll. It is important to notice that, differently from text-format lllls proper, Max-format lllls might not be invertible even if they do not reach the size limit for Max message. This means that a bach object receiving a Max-format llll output from another bach object might interpret it differently from the original, or in some cases might even reject it.
x: disabled output (nothing is output)
p: 'portal' output: only used by bach.portal to intercept the @out attribute specified while creating the abstraction (see bach.portal).
The native output is recommended, unless communication with standard Max messages is needed. Disabling unused outputs can be useful if extreme optimization of the patch is needed.

attribute.name: phasefield
attribute.description: Sets the name of the field (column) bearing the BPM phase value, if any (use "none" to avoid defining it).

attribute.name: playcolor
attribute.description: Sets the playing color.

attribute.name: playstep
attribute.description: Sets the play step interval in milliseconds.

attribute.name: relativeknn
attribute.description: If relativeknn is on, the values used for the knn message are expected to be between 0 and 1, corresponding to the minimum and maximum coordinates displayed in the domain and range of the object (caveat: more precisely, to the domain and range of the latest painted view of the object).

attribute.name: relativeturtle
attribute.description: If relativeturtle is on, the values used for the turtle, setturtle and turtledelta messages are expected to be between 0 and 1, corresponding to the minimum and maximum coordinates displayed in the domain and range of the object (caveat: more precisely, to the domain and range of the latest painted view of the object).

attribute.name: shapefield
attribute.description: Sets the name of the field (column) to be mapped on the grain shape, if any (use "none" to avoid defining it). Must be an integer field (1 being mapped to a circle, 2 to a triangle, 3 to a square, and so on)

attribute.name: showlegend
attribute.description: Toggles the ability to display the point legend on mousehover.

attribute.name: showturtle
attribute.description: Toggles the ability to display the turtle.

attribute.name: sizefield
attribute.description: Sets the name of the field (column) to be mapped on the grain size, if any (use "none" to avoid defining it).

attribute.name: snaptogrid
attribute.description: Toggles the ability to snap items to the grid.

attribute.name: stopbeatsonmouseleave
attribute.digest: Stop Beat Sync Bangs When Mouse Leaves
attribute.description: Toggles the ability to stop beat sync bangs to be sent out from the last outlet when mouse leaves the object.

attribute.name: label
attribute.value: Stop Beat Sync Bangs When Mouse Leaves

attribute.name: stoplooponmouseleave
attribute.digest: Stop Looped Playing When Mouse Leaves
attribute.description: Toggles the ability to stop looped playing when mouse leaves the object.

attribute.name: label
attribute.value: Stop Looped Playing When Mouse Leaves

attribute.name: stoploopwhennothovered
attribute.digest: Stop Looped Playing When Mouse Is Not Hovering
attribute.description: Toggles the ability to stop looped playing when mouse is not hovering any point

attribute.name: label
attribute.value: Stop Looped Playing When Mouse Is Not Hovering

attribute.name: table
attribute.description: Sets the name of the database table to be displayed.

attribute.name: turtlecolor
attribute.description: Sets the color of the turtle.

attribute.name: undobang
attribute.description: Toggles the ability to send the changed bang also when changes happen via messages.

attribute.name: undobeforeplay
attribute.digest: Save State For Undo Before Playing
attribute.description: Toggles the ability to save the state for an undo step before playing

attribute.name: label
attribute.value: Save State For Undo Before Playing

attribute.name: verboseundo
attribute.description: Toggles the ability to post undo/redo steps in the Max window.

attribute.name: where
attribute.description: Sets the SQLite 'WHERE' clause to sieve displayed data.

attribute.name: xfield
attribute.description: Sets the name of the field (column) to be displayed on the X axis.

attribute.name: yfield
attribute.description: Sets the name of the field (column) to be displayed on the Y axis.

entry.name: Inlet 1 (anything)
entry.description: Incoming knn message or bang to refresh.
